name: ITP-HA0423-ELE-003 - Underground Ducts Below Slab
template name: ITP-HA0423-ELE-003 - Underground Ducts Below Slab - Rev C

name: 01 - Delivery inspection of HDPE ducts and fittings
Acceptance Criteria - Correct SDR, diameter and undamaged
Remarks - Material CoC matches spec; no damage No damaged packing material.
Spec/standard - NZ Certifications; standards and industry training
Hold Points Sign off - Hold Point
Remarks - Welder certification reviewed and approved prior works Hawkins- ITP-000061
Acceptance Criteria - Installed as per project drawings and specifications
Remarks - Suitable route and bend allowances
Acceptance Criteria - Installed as per drawing
Remarks - No excessive bends or misalignments
05 - Inspection of duct cleanliness and joint
Acceptance Criteria - Ends scraped, dry, and clean
Reporting Format - OMX Quality check sheet
Remarks - Free of debris, scratches, moisture
06 - Fusion setup – pipe end scraping, machine check
Acceptance Criteria - Scraping complete, scan barcode
Reporting Format - OMX Quality check sheet
Remarks - Pre-weld approved by supervisor before fusion
Acceptance Criteria - Parameters met; uniform bead
Reporting Format - Fusion log / OMX Quality check sheet
Remarks - Fusion data logged and bead visually compliant Weld number time and date next to weld.
08 - Post Weld visual inspection and cooling
Acceptance Criteria - Bead uniform, cooled per spec
Reporting Format - OMX Quality check sheet
Remarks - Cooling time respected; weld integrity confirmed.
Acceptance Criteria - Barcode and weld ID logged
Reporting Format - OMX Quality Check sheet
Remarks - Log completed and ID matched field location
Acceptance Criteria - CCTV footage of below ground ducting, duct contains no debris or penetrations that could damage cable sheath when pulled
Remarks - Submission of CCTV footage before handover
Acceptance Criteria - Electro fusion welder calibration certificate
Remarks - Submission of calibration certificate before handover
Acceptance Criteria - Minimum bending radius of 2m
Remarks - Heat apply using controlled hot air: duct support during bending. Cool down in place to retain shape
Acceptance Criteria - Wire securely fixed on top of duct, continuous, accessible at both ends
Remarks - Tracer wire to be installed above duct, secured at 3m intervals. Ends terminated in accessible pits or boxes
15 - Installation of Warning Tape and Polymeric Cover (Mag slab) during Backfilling
Acceptance Criteria - Install 300mm above top of duct.
Measuring Devices - Tape measure, visual check
Remarks - Materials supplied by Omexom, installation by civil contractor.
○ Hold point required prior to backfilling. Supplier to verify delivery and provide installation guidance. Coordination required to ensure correct placement and documentation.
Frequency - Each duct at each pit
Acceptance Criteria - Manufacturer’s installation guidelines and project specifications
Measuring Devices - Secure, watertight connection between duct and pit; no gaps or misalignment
Reporting Format - Visual check, QA checklist / photograph
17 - Coordination with Waterproofing and Concrete Encasing
Frequency - At each interface with waterproofing or encasement
Spec/standard - MMD DP Buildings Elec Spec July 2024 7.3.3.12
Acceptance Criteria - IFC drawings and Sika Details (by others)
5. Document Deliverables (The documents listed below shall be completed and compiled during the course of the construction)
For delivery inspection of HDPE ducts and fittings.
